Sequence Information.Function: Catalyzes an oxidative deamination of predominantly hydrophobic and aromatic L-amino acids, thus producing hydrogen peroxide that may contribute to the diverse toxic effects of this enzyme. Exhibits diverse biological activities, such as hemorrhage, edema, antibacterial and antiparasitic activities, as well as regulation of platelet aggregation. Effects of snake L-amino oxidases on platelets are controversial, since they either induce aggregation or inhibit agonist-induced aggregation. These different effects are probably due to different experimental conditions (By similarity). This protein has an ability to induce hemolysis and apoptosis.

Literature.Title: Apoptotic effect in the glioma cells induced by specific protein extracted from Okinawa Habu (Trimeresurus flavoviridis) venom in relation to oxidative stress.
Literature.Author: Saito A.,Tsurushima H.,Hyodo A.,Yoshii Y.,Sun L.-K.

Literature.Title: Characterization of an apoptosis-inducing factor in Habu snake venom as a glycyrrhizin (GL)-binding protein potently inhibited by GL in vitro.
Literature.Author: Nagata N.,Ito J.,Munakata H.,Shimoyama Y.,Abe Y.
